intro: Uragoga subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved uragoga, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features include a woody stem and opposite leaf arrangement. Uragoga subsessilis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
